intro: Enchosanthera, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its flowers have five petals that curl inward as they age. Enchosanthera is valued for its ornamental beauty and its ability to bloom in the cool evening air.
